title: Awesome, but still room for improvements!
text:
We mainly got Doorbird as a replacement to our building's analog intercom system to add remote unlcoking of the front gate.

Living in an Apple ecosystem, I do wish for Homekit support (which they are working on!) and more speedier response time, in terms of opening the app and the keyfobs. Our system is on a wired connection and still can take up to 10 seconds to get the live feed.

title: Great products and good app to match
text:
I‚Äôve had a DoorBird at my house for almost two years and I‚Äôm very pleased with it. I haven‚Äôt had any trouble with it. The app‚Äôs interface is simple and straightforward. It has everything you need and nothing more. You open the app and see the door right away, then one tap to answer. Snapshots and history are just as easy to access. The settings menus are a bit complicated, but as a technical person I prefer having more options than less. Once it‚Äôs all set up, you never need to mess with the settings anyway. 

I had a Ring doorbell before this and it was okay, but not great (both device and app). At my new house, the contractor installed a Control4 doorphone and I had him replace it with another DoorBird because the C4 intercom app was not nearly as good.

title: A major notifications bug and poor UX
text:
There are a number of issues with the app:
- There is a bug in its push notifications on iOS. The doorbell and motion alarms become permanently silent after switching the phone to Silent Mode and then back to Ringer mode from the side toggle. The only way to have the push notifications have sound again is to go into the DoorBird app settings and toggle the Activate button for each notification. This needs to be done each time after the phone is switched back to Ringer. I have now missed so many doorbells as a result that the whole point of having the DoorBird in order to open our gate on demand, has substantially diminished in utility for us.

- The camera view doesn‚Äôt load when the app is opened by tapping on a push notification - which is the typical user experience when trying to respond to the doorbell. You actually need to tap on the camera view button in the app (bottom left corner) to get the camera view to refresh and display.

- The app UI and UX look like they haven‚Äôt  been updated for about 10 years - the app is in a desperate need for a refresh to a more modern interface.

title: Frustrating, slow, easy to miss notifications
text:
We were excited when our landlord upgraded our entry system at first. However it‚Äôs been a huge disappointment for the following major reasons:

1) The app doesn‚Äôt bypass your phone‚Äôs silent mode. So if you leave your phone on vibrate and you don‚Äôt have it right in front of you at all times, you miss deliveries constantly.

2) The app is EXTREMELY slow. Even if I‚Äôm staring at the phone and immediately click the notification when the doorbell rings, it still takes 5-10 seconds for it to load video footage. If you want to try to talk to the person, it takes even longer. We basically never try talking to delivery people anymore because by the time it actually gets your audio to them, 9 times out of 10 they‚Äôve already left.

I wanted to like this system, but those two absolutely killer flaws completely ruin it. 2 stars because it‚Äôs nice to have video footage (when it loads) and it‚Äôs nice to be able to buzz people in when you‚Äôre not home (if you don‚Äôt miss the notification and it doesn‚Äôt take so long to open they don‚Äôt leave first).

title: Good idea, poor execution, I‚Äôd never install this service on my own property
text:
The app is an example of a good idea with poor execution.

1) If somebody rings the door, it takes approx 30-45 seconds to pull up the video in app if you click the notification ASAP. It then takes a little while longer to trigger the lock. In total it can easily be a minute which often times leads to the delivery driver leaving.

2) The UI on the door doesn‚Äôt say ANYTHING to the person buzzing the door. It basically just goes to the main screen. The person is clueless as to what is happening, so they sometimes leave.

3) Because the notifications are just app based, it only shows as a banner in your phone and if you don‚Äôt have vibrate/volume up you very often miss the notification. So the deliver driver leaves.

4) The app has a lot of bugs. It often glitches, crashes and overall is very slow to operate.

I‚Äôve missed a lot of packages because of this app, and I‚Äôve got to say I rather just have the usual phone call when somebody‚Äôs at the door to let them in. It‚Äôs much more practical and instant.

title: Customer
text: We have had our DoorBird security system installed over a year ago by an electrician in our area.  They did not know how to set it up so we have never been shown the features of our system.  All of the literature that they left with us only shows how to install and not how to operate.  I have tried to call Door Bird several times to find someone in our area to go through and set up correctly,  but I have  been unsuccessful.  The system that we had installed was very expensive and with the install cost we could of gotten a local security company to install and received the service to hookup correctly.  I am very discouraged by the service of this company!

title: Below average
text: I had this for a few months and this is my second one . The first one I had to send back due to the lens forming a permanent glare in its center. I was glad that  it was still covered by  warranty . I am hoping that  will not have the same problem again . The second thing is the app and it‚Äôs speed . Even though this camera is hardwired to my internet it will take forever to load the app in order to see a live view . The chime that I bought with it will take a delay of 10 to 20 seconds to ring . Too expensive for such a product . Stay away

title: Needs better notification.
text: Our building just installed a DoorBird system. We love the ability to answer the door and let someone in regardless of where we are. The problem is the notification needs to be significantly better. They are a little delayed and it‚Äôs just a simple banner. If only it alerted you like a call, so it‚Äôs impossible to ignore. By the time we see the notification, they are already gone. Since getting this system, we are routinely missing deliveries. Hopefully they can improve this. I‚Äôm shocked there‚Äôs not a way to set your own notification settings.

title: Hardly works!
text: Everyone in the community is having trouble connecting and people at the gate are waiting for a long time. The app just keeps buffering for minutes until finally you close it out and open it only to find it does the same thing. It works 30% of the time for me.

title: Expected more from device
text:
The app is very easy to use and it was easy to setup but the performance of the connection between device & phone app is  slow sometimes. The phone app displays the image but it lags or is choppy. 
With the recent updates it seems to be working better.

title: No matter what I do I can‚Äôt login
text: I have tried many times to provide an email address and set up the pro part of the app, to no avail. It won‚Äôt confirm the email address and you can‚Äôt even pay $ to authorize it to keep recordings. These people are leaving money on the table because the app does not work.

title: Great intercom!!
text: This is by far the best intercom / front door bell I have had. It works with basically anything. The only issue I have is the wire connectors come loose and disrupt connection. If somehow these connectors were improved the DoorBird is your one stop intercom or door bell solution. Looks modern, works like a champion. German made quality

title: Poor sound, latency
text:
The sound coming out of the intercom is very crackly and poor. Also, there is at least two second delay between when someone speaks and it actually comes out the intercom.
Five second delay in being able to speak to anybody after answering. Five second delay after pressing door open, to when it actually unlocks.
Also, the phone does not vibrate when there is an incoming intercom call.  üòë

title: Actually got it to work!!!
text:
What doorbird does not tell you:

If you get a new Phone and restore the doorbird app from a backup or transfer from your old phone, the app will transfer just fine -  but push notifications won‚Äôt!

I tried for over 6 months to figure out why none of my doorbell button would push through to my phone - because the push notification is tied to the phone hardware not the software!

If you get a new phone, delete the doorbird app and re-install - that will bring push notifications back!

title: Has been reliable but make sure you install properly
text: I have two units setup on our system. Both work perfectly. I would highly recommend hardwiring these devices to your network. Using a wireless connection add additional chances of the unit not operating as intended.

title: Not a consumer product
text: I have had this for 2 years at my home.  I originally purchased as it would integrate with Control4.  I have tried to be positive and make it work but it is simply not a consumer product.  The App is not intuitive and is buggy/laggy.  I really needed it to work the other day (prowler) and it did not pick anything up.  All the app documentation is about configuration versus using the system (ie common use cases).  I installed the Ring in my old house.  I will be going back to it.

title: instructions
text:
The instructions on the unit are too small and vendors complained about it.
The instructions should be easy to read.
I gave it 1 star and you reject any nick name
This is a sub standard product do not buy it
With 5 stars you accept my nickname, you are a fraud

title: Nothing but trouble!
text: App is so so. Equipment which should be excellent is full of troubles. Speaker is horrible on our busy urban street, after it rains a certain way the system goes haywire and we have to manually reboot, camera is not good when the sun is behind the person - person looks very dark and cannot see their features, Doorbird says that many issues from system constantly doing firmware updates. So many reasons to Stay away!

title: Not for a business.
text: Just not reliable enough to open the door remotely for our visiting clients. Works most of the time, fails or lags so often however that overall I consider this system unreliable. And an occasional lag would be acceptable but what we‚Äôre experiencing is about 35% of the time there‚Äôs a huge lag or it just doesn‚Äôt work. Also, too many steps to just unlock the door, I have to open the app, select something, confirm that...

title: Apple Watch Video Support
text: This app would be even better if video would show on the Apple Watch when some is at the door.  Currently, it only shows a Talk & Open (door lock) buttons.   These guys are pretty sharp and I am surprised that they have not figured this out yet.

title: Review
text: Takes too long to respond; by the time I get to either talk to or view who‚Äôs there they have left. I hardly ever use it other than to see which door is being used as the ring is the same for both doors so I have to wait for the app to open to see which door to go to.  There should be an option for different rings at different doors.

title: I miss way more deliveries with DoorBird
text:
I live in an apartment building in a city and our building uses DoorBird as its doorbell system. Since we switched, I‚Äôve missed so many more package and mail deliveries. 

A push notification isn‚Äôt enough to alert me most of the time, especially when I‚Äôm not expecting one. I wish the app would call me so I don‚Äôt have to constantly pay attention to notifications on my phone

title: Image in notifications please!
text: When DoorBird sends a mobile notification can you include an image from the camera similar to what other products like Nest do? Would be super useful!

title: Worst device
text:
This doesn‚Äôt work I have spent almost 1 k on things to get this to work. When and I do mean when I get contact with support all they say is buy this or that and when it doesn‚Äôt still work they say it‚Äôs my internet. Funny ring, nest, and gate opener all work outside of my house. I can open or answer my door from anywhere in the world. But doorbird says its not there product. 
Don‚Äôt buy till they care about customers first.

title: Very unreliable
text:
I have had a DoorBird for 4years. In that time it has worked maybe 50% of the time. Does not work properly over Wi-Fi as advertised.
I have had a replacement unit that also failed to function.
If there was a viable alternative I would use anything but this

title: Good Intercom Needs More Features
text: Would be nice when I get a notification it shows a photo of who‚Äôs at the gate. Other than that it‚Äôs a great system for the price.

title: Won‚Äôt hold live stream
text: This has been a very frustrating experience. I have doorbird at my business door. Some days I can‚Äôt keep the live stream at all some days it holds fine. I reboot constantly; hardware and software. Very high maintenance and exhausting. I do not recommend doorbird to my clients.

title: Best for Integration
text: The doorbird works best if trying to integrate it into and intercoms system etc. It has relay terminals. PLUS this doorbell can connect POE or 10base-t.  That's probably the biggest Plus!!!  You don't have to rely on a wifi connection with the DoorBird!  Keep it up

title: Happy with my purchase
text: Very happy with my service. I wish you didn‚Äôt have to pay for the storage after a year, but we love it. Very reliable.

title: Keeps uninstalling the device
text: The app worked well for a year. But just this month, it keeps asking me to add the DoorBird device. It doesn‚Äôt stay in the app. I have saved it every time. I tried deleting and reinstalling the app. The problem keeps happening. I keep missing deliveries because of this. This is so frustrating. I have an iPhone 12 Pro with iOS 14.5.1.

title: DoorBird
text: Worst door system I have ever had.  No one can hear you on the intercom system.  They can‚Äôt see the listing to dial up the person.  I live in a mid rise so there are about a 100 people in my building.  I am first on the list so the hit my name and I am getting calls all the time. So I shut it off if I am not expecting a package or a Vistor.  Would never recommend this system.

title: It does the job, if on your phone
text:
My landlord used this app for my unit. The latency is ok (not blazing fast but not super slow either). 

I like the idea and the simple UI overall.

The only downside for me are the notifications. My phone does not vibrate when someone rings! 
If my phone is on silent (which is most of the time), I will miss the notification‚Ä¶ I started to take the habit of leaving it on ring to lake sure I don‚Äôt miss it :/ quite annoying.

title: Big delay and poor visuals
text: By the time I use my phone app to see who is at the door or use the microphone to speak to them they have turned away and are halfway down the driveway. I hardly recognize my kids on the poor visuals on the camera... I just know their mannerisms and gait. Go with a Ring or something else. Door Bird is too expensive to justify for the poor quality.

title: Old fashioned doorbell would be better
text:
Bell does not sound. No longer pushes door notifications to my phone. When it worked properly it was often too slow to respond to people waiting at door. 

Update requires a credit card and says it will not charge you but then immediately charges your card $19. 

I will continue my search for a better product.

title: Watch App Doesn‚Äôt Work Properly
text: There are two screens on the watch. The first is supposed to show a screen shot or video. The second allows communication and gate operation. However, the first screen is blank/black-no screen shot or video. Arlo watch app does this but it seems Doorbird hasn‚Äôt figured out this basic and critical functionality.  Rating 1 star.

title: Poor picture, bad audio
text:
I‚Äôve had the door bird for 4 years. 
No one can ever hear me and I cannot hear anyone from the door bird. 
The video is useless. 
All we see is a shadow for the picture. 
If we know the person we can sort of guess who the person is. 
The only good thing is that there‚Äôs no charge to capture the poor picture. 
Sorry we waisted our money. I called the company and explained. The company offered a discount for a new one. I just can‚Äôt bring ourselves to spend more for a replacement. 
I will buy something else when the prices come down.

title: Great Service!
text: Like the system and flexibility it offers. Audio quality can be better. Amazing service even though they are based in Germany.  Prompt response and great follow up.

title: Poor Bird
text: Product works very poorly.  We‚Äôve had to replace two of them due to low image quality.  Also, it takes at least 15-30 seconds to activate on the phone app., and frequently won‚Äôt activate at all.

title: Gets flaky
text: We loved this at first. Unfortunately it has gotten flakier over time and we‚Äôve had quite a few service calls. We‚Äôre pondering upgrades vs replacement. Several people have confused the ringer button with the night camera and the camera dome is mushed in.

title: Very Slow to Load & Poor Notifications
text: This App seems like it‚Äôs still in development.  User interface is poor.  Notifications are spotty and lack good controls to do things like increase the volume so you don‚Äôt miss notifications.  Maybe look into adding text, phone and/or desktop notifications.

title: Needs to be faster
text: Slow to load

title: Terrible
text: I wish our building would switch from DoorBird it‚Äôs really the worst. No one can figure out how to buzz people so packages are left outside constantly. And when they do figure it out the app takes forever to load so they give up before we can buzz them in because they assume it‚Äôs not working.

title: Not for house the faces sunlight and not for house that has an enclosed entrance door.
text:
I had two professional install and unable to see person thru this product and not understand when they talk.
Waste of money. I had to replace with Ring.
Also according to demo the new improved DoorBird wouldn‚Äôt work either....
Go back to drawing board

title: Not ready for prime time
text: This is a very expensive beta product. Pressing the door open on the app to actually buzzing to door takes 10 seconds. Old school electric system was instant. Also the Apple Watch door open doesn‚Äôt work but the function is presented on the watch. Please fix.

title: Good concept but slow server and unfinished app
text:
Concept is great but the implementation is poor. Takes a long time to connect even on home gigabit network. Very slow response on cell network. 

Application admin pages are unfinished and need a lot of improvements to make it usable. Even the installers had problems

title: Out dated
text: This is a German company who is competing with American products such as Google nest and ring to complex to set up cameras is poor For its price it easily breaks down

title: Average
text: Camera just average. Not a great picture and not wide range enough to actually see people. Doorbell sometimes works, sometimes doesn‚Äôt. Would not recommend

title: Not happy
text: The app doesn't want to open in the guest tab . I keep getting a spinning arrow. It worked once & then not.

title: Stopped working after last iOS update
text: Not resp mid game since last iOS update.  Pls pls fix and keep up to date.

title: Please fix
text:
Version 4.90 displays all relays when tapping the unlock button even if the relay is not given access permission. 

Now unlocking the door is a two step process where you have to choose the relay to unlock.

Would be great if we could set a default relay for the unlock button.

title: Get better speed for downloading
text: Love this application but just takes a little long term to download the video !

title: Poor Customer Care
text:
Doesn‚Äôt integrate with modern home video surveillance system
Picture quality not great
Customer support dreadful or absent.
HIGHLY UNRELIABLE.

title: DoorBird
text: So far I‚Äôve been very disappointed with this app. I can barely hear the chime when someone comes to my door. The camera is terrible. I want to switch back to my old doorbell now. I have to have people call me on my cell so I know they‚Äôre here because this app doesn‚Äôt work very well.

title: Delayed reaction
text:
I love the concept. 
I like the system. 
I cannot stand how long it takes to load and the delay between someone ringing and when I get a notification or if I get a notification . It‚Äôs always a problem.

title: Painfully slow
text: Terrible and I wish my building had something better. The few times I actually get notified it takes the app minutes for it to finally connect. It‚Äôs actually faster if I just go downstairs to open the door myself.

title: Horrible
text: I don‚Äôt think if anyone truly tried they could make this system more convoluted!!! Horrible!!  Even trying to leave a review is ridiculous!! I‚Äôve tried 6 different names and all are apparently used. You must have the system set up to stop bad reviews.

title: 5 Stars!
text: Easy efficient and accessible even away from location.

title: If you have a problem good luck
text: They never respond.

title: Review
text:
The look of the device is nice. 
People are confused where to push the ringer. 
The picture is not clear and is shaky. 
People can‚Äôt hear me clearly through the speaker.

title: Upgrade screwed up operations!
text: Doorbird was working perfectly until the last upgrade. Now whenever the gate opens up it stays frozen open regardless of how we try to open or unlock or reset. Very disappointing I hope they fix this soon

title: Slow!
text:
This app doesn‚Äôt work that great with this system. It takes forever for the camera to
load and for the trigger to turn green and let someone in. I end up having to go downstairs anyway because of how long it takes.

title: Problem
text: Had for a year and worked well (would have been 5 star) but since update, it‚Äôs glitchy.

title: Not great
text: This just isn‚Äôt a great system.  Not sure how well the combination of Wi-Fi and mobile data can ever work but this is so poor as to render it almost useless.  Poorly designed user interface does not help.  I have seen better implementations of smart video/doorbell to cell phone.

title: Feeling safe !!
text: We really like our bird. It‚Äôs free and helps us feel safe !! the app is easy to use !!

title: Notifications not working
text: I have the latest iOS and versions, but the notifications have stopped working. So, I don‚Äôt know when someone is at the gate. Very frustrating.

title: Slow
text: The app is so slow by time you open the app to check who is at the door that person is gone!!

title: Understanding each other.
text: I can‚Äôt hear them very well and they can‚Äôt hear or understand me very well. Do you have any suggestions?

title: Sound
text: It‚Äôs unfortunate such an expensive product has such poor quality audio. I install these due to the integration with third-party controllers and all of my clients including myself complaining that no one can hear you when you‚Äôre talking

title: Notifications delayed and easy to miss
text: When call goes through can see 20 sec delays from call to notify. Notification is very subtle (vs a phone call). Call box gives no feedback when connecting so many mossed calls.

title: Lags way too much
text: Our internet connection and streaming / internet TV throughout our house is super fast, but DoorBird is way too slow and doesn‚Äôt stay connected well

title: The Ring is probably better than this
text: We have installed a fancy AV system at our house and door bird has about a 25% usability rate meaning 75% of the time it doesn‚Äôt work, the speakers don‚Äôt work, it crashes, Hass to be reset, Has to be disabled until the technicians can come. HORRIBLE

title: Unreliable
text: Hasn‚Äôt worked a single day since it was installed a year ago. Sound is poor on the rare occasion it works at all. Alerts are delayed. Totally useless and will replace with another brand. Only reason for two stars instead of one is that customer service is helpful.

title: 3rd Floor Residential unit
text:
When it works it‚Äôs great!
 The problem is consistency and slow recovery when the first attempt with the fob doesn‚Äôt work.
People unfamiliar with the system have difficulty entering without several attempts. It‚Äôs not a very intuitive system.
If there was an add on manual button ‚Äúbuzzer‚Äù I would buy it.

title: Cloud video
text: I would of given it a 5 star if I could figure out cloud video set up.

title: Horrible product
text: I‚Äôve had so many problems with this product. Constantly stops working. No sound at the door lock to indicate the door is unlocked. Terrible sound too. I feel like I need to put a ring right next to the DoorBird so I can at least predictably communicate.

title: Great App
text: DoorBird brings great engineering to their products.  Well made app and always updated.

title: Lots of issues
text: Doorbell doesn‚Äôt always work properly. Every type of motion gets picked up and I get literally 99 plus alerts over night which maybe only bugs and the video isn‚Äôt clear at all so half the time I barely notice who is at my door.

title: Good concept - poor execution
text:
Our HOA was very excited for the New DoorBird system but realized after a while that we were missing too many ‚ÄúDoorBird calls‚Äù.
1) need a more robust notification 
2) faster notification 
- by the time we realized we got a call the person left in exasperation 
3) how about a visual cue so that they know their call was answered 
4) better speakers so we can hear them when they‚Äôre talking to us.

Hopefully the techs can improve upon the current system so we don‚Äôt have to completely scrap it.

title: Good, but...
text: Device does a good job putting a door notice onto a screen (cellphone, tablet, laptop), but audible ringer rarely works. Need the sound, for anyone who isn‚Äôt watching a screen.

title: Total crap!
text: The worst junk i ever had  installed.  Doesnt work.  So slow in sending signals and ring people leave before you can get the app open. Installed additional router still doesnt work    Junk. Installers push this crap out and it doesn't belong in the US. Stay in Europe youre not ready for prine time here

title: This app is atrocious.
text:
TLDR: Please do not give this company money. They make a subpar product. 

This app is awful. It gives me no confidence about whether the door is locked or unlocked. 

Also it's notifications system is fundamentally broken. The notifications are SILENT. This means if I have a two hour delivery window I'm going to be checking my phone every 5 minutes to see if someone is waiting outside. 

The notifications should behave like PagerDuty which are loud and obnoxious so it's clear to me someone is outside.

title: Recent update has trashed performance
text: Recent update has caused the loading time for live videos to increase drastically such that the video loads after the person who rang has already left.

title: Doorbird
text: The volume and clarity are not very good. Night lighting quit working shortly after doorbird installed. I do like being able to see who is at the gate

title: It works once in a while.
text:
Try anything else. Constantly resetting up when any software change. 
Complete waste of money.

title: Poorly Executed Long Delays
text:
I am all for high-tech solutions, but his DoorBird product is only half baked, burdened by long delays and low sound haptics.  

 I wish I still had my doorbell tied to my Landline, so I could hear the bell and IMMEDIATELY talk as well as buzz my guests inside.  DoorBird does neither effectively.

title: Volume on speaker if you‚Äôre out of town
text: I cannot hear the person at the door if I‚Äôm out of town.  Sounds great if I‚Äôm in the house, which doesn‚Äôt help much.

title: Don‚Äôt.
text: Absolute trash. App crashes continually. Now I have to walk down 4 flights of stairs to let people in. If you are thinking of upgrading your door buzzing system this definitely is not an upgrade

title: RAIN MOTION SENSOR
text: Would be helpful to update the app to not notify motion detection repeatedly during rain or even people standing at the camera for an extended amount of time.

title: No No No
text: Wowza this is bad. If my BF hadn‚Äôt cut a big chunk of the wall out to install the hardware already this would have been sent to the dump long ago. FAILURE. I can‚Äôt leave the house without a regular key as backup because the app so consistently doesn‚Äôt work.

title: Do not i eat in doorbird
text: Terrible! So many issues I do not recommend doorbird. After all the money spent we may need to invest in a new system. Can‚Äôt hear door bell. Video shuts off. Phantom rings throughout the night. Already replaced system once. Such waste if our money.

text:
The bird only chips one time at a low volume.  Use older people need multiple chips and a volume control

title: Sketchy WiFi
text: More often than not I cannot answer the door because the the WiFi will not connect.

title: Very, very poor UI
text: If your building gets one of these, protest immediately. Hard to use and wildly inconsistent. We‚Äôve considered moving out just because of this. What a disappointing product...

title: Not a fan
text: Hate how the DoorBird alert to my phone is one vibrate. Because of this, I miss packages and notifications all of the time. Wish they would modify the single alert to a call or multiple vibrates.

title: Germany
text:
Very poor product. I am unable to access from my phone therefore there is. I communication with anyone at the door. 
I would not recommend this product to anyone.

text: The system is slow and doesn‚Äôt always ring cell , nor does it always unlock doors as well as send elevator‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.  Respectfully if there was a grade of half-star that is what I would give

title: Doorbird
text: Microphone is poor quality. Camera needs better backlight control. Can hardly see the person. Ring much better quality but does not connect to a pre installed alarm system intercom.

title: Cannot update my doorbell due to my audio visual technician is no longer available

text: Have nothing but constant issues. Station disconnects and you are unaware until friends tell you they rang and you didn‚Äôt answer. Wouldn‚Äôt recommend

title: I hate my doorbird
text: I don‚Äôt usually write App Store reviews, but I hate my doorbird doorbell so much I felt compelled to warn others away.  I‚Äôm seriously considering paying a few grand get an analog doorbell installed instead.  It‚Äôs that bad.

title: Delays

title: poor audio quality

title: Worst purchase I have ever made
text: It just doesn‚Äôt work at all. Do not get this product. You will regret it as my entire family has.

title: The Worst!
text: I should have gotten Ring! This app works maybe half the time. Terrible. And there‚Äôs no customer service number ‚Äî I have to pay to have a locksmith come out to troubleshoot it every time. Maddening.

title: Engineer
text: It would be nice to get a feedback that would indicate if the gate is open or closed.

title: Great app

title: Device kinda ok, support... what Support???
text:
If your a professional installer looking for Wi-Fi enabled solution as an alternative to the ‚ÄúR‚Äù word product, that can be integrated into Crestron, Control4, etc; this is about the only option.

And if your a pro, the best advice I can give you is to completely open the system up and pre-Configure it, do firmware updates and make certain you have it all working 100% before taking it to a client Home... make sure if it‚Äôs not being offered on a T&M basis, you allow for at least 4 hours of install time to deal with having to stage the device and deal with Support issues... if you don‚Äôt stage it, expect to start he Project on day and drive back to the site 1-3 more times before it‚Äôs all working.

Doorbird Support is an absolute joke.  Once you actually reach someone (which is the biggest challenge, if it‚Äôs one of the main people in Germany your in luck.  If it‚Äôs someone at the US office, they may be helpful or they will just send out new parts.

As for product shipping, evidently they don‚Äôt have any US distribution.  So when you place an order, be prepared for limited communication; just like with Support.  When you track the packages, they will appear to have been prepared for shipment but never actually ship... then 10-14 days later they  appear out of no where.

As for the hardware itself, once it‚Äôs working, it‚Äôs great.  As for it being a plug-n-play like their biggest competitor, not even close if your taking about a retro fit product that requires Wi-Fi.

I‚Äôve installed the door stations and Door chime boxes.  Neither worked out of the box as advertised and required updates to get going.

The instructions they come with are often based on a newer or older firmware version so they don‚Äôt exactly correspond with the device your working with.

All that said, if their support didn‚Äôt take between 48-72 hours to respond to a Support ticket and they didn‚Äôt make their phone contact nearly impossible to locate; these little issues they have would not be a huge problem... the problem really is with their support.  Whether your a DIY or pro, expecting someone to start an install and have it take a week or more to complete, just because Support is unresponsive is completely unacceptable.

As best I can tell, if the people within this company spent half much $$$ on staffing their support team as they do on trade shows pimping their products to builders, architects, and other trades; they could probably grow their business quite well organically.  But with so many people like myself bad-mouthing the company, they seem doomed; at least in USA.

So... like I said before, if your a professional integrator and need a Wi-Fi enable solution that can be integrated, this is it.  But if you can get a wire to your device, pay no attention to the fact they have a $300 solution and spend a couple hundred more on something from a better competitor that can be integrated.  I can assure you that $250 saved on hardware will be far superseded in time spent by your technical dept making this thing work.

Other important notes that aren‚Äôt obvious until you install one:

- Drivers for Control 4 do not support video to a mobile device app; only the C4 Touch-screens

- Though most doorbells ( at least in US) require a 24vac power supply, these take a 12vdc, so be prepared to be digging around looking for the pre-existing doorbell transformer and getting a DC transformer plugged in Place.

- most doorbells are wired with like 22 gauge or higher wire.  So if the original doorbell transformer is too far away, it‚Äôs quite likely you‚Äôll suffer voltage drop which will result in unreliable operations... especially when the night vision kicks on.  While the right solution is probably to run a new wire, which is usually impossible without major hole cutting and mess, you might try the high-powered Optional  DIN rail power supply they offer.

title: Not the best‚Ä¶. Update: Failure! Will not work now and has become a decoration
text: So, i have had this for a year now and not impressed. It is finicky. It will disconnected and then i miss parcel delivery‚Äôs. Or friends will have to call me to open the door. Just out of the blue. Every once and awhile. I have to switch the power off in the panels and on again and do the whole reboot. That added feature in the app to avoid that, does not work. The thing that really is a bummer is that when someone buzzes, it takes awhile to answer. Run to the phone , unlock the phone, wait for the app to boot up. Most deliveries are gone by then and they throw the package over the fence. Thanks! Grrrrr. I put a sticker on the doorbird to tell people to give me 15 secs to answer. It is not great. I recently activated the recording feature and hate it! I thought maybe i did something wrong. Like most, i do not want to be on notice every minute. Just record the activity and i will look back if needed. Nope. You cannot do it. Either you get a notice and then it records, or you turn the notice off and you get no recordings. I would not recommend this product. Update: well it looks like it has now failed with some kind of network error that they cannot fix on their end and I would be forced to hire someone to open the face of the DoorBird and connect an Ethernet cable to it and my modem to reconnect it to my WiFi? What the crap is that about? So I am done. There is no way I am paying more for this crap when a ring doorbell or better yet Eufy video doorbell can be installed for a 3 rd of the price and work better.

title: Great product and app
text: After a 3-year odyssey with other products, my search seems finally to have come to an end. I‚Äôve had a DoorBird for 2 weeks now - works perfectly. A good internet and network connection is important, of course. I decided to use the LAN cable connection and my internet connection is about 80Mbits. I also connected a doorbell and an electric door opener. The product is unfortunately more expensive than its "predecessors" from the competition, but I had to throw them away after only a year each! And I only had a fraction of the scope, functionality and stability. If any problems appear I will let you know.

title: Great product
text:
I tested a number of App based video door systems. This one performs by far the best since one can connect the device directly to an Ethernet cable (also PoE capable). Moreover, one can wire an indoor doorbell, and an electric door lock. In my location, wifi is unreliable outside the house since there is a plaster wall that blocks much of the wifi signal.

An additional bonus of this system is that one  gets faster connectivity when the iPhone or iPad is on the same LAN. Connectivity from the outside internet is also robust, but of course depends on the network speed of the ISP.

The unit looks very nice - I got the more expensive flush mounted version. It's a bit of an effort to pull the wires and cut out the opening for the unit, but it's worth the effort.

The bottom line is that this is by far the best App based door system that I have tested.

title: Update: Cloud Recording
text:
Update: Loving the new Cloud Recording feature. 

---------------------

I had been searching for a good smartphone-enabled video entry phone for some time. This had great reviews, although not as widely known as the "flimsier" competitors. Was also much cheaper than the "enterprise" solutions from Siedle and Aiphone. 

Installation and integration was easy. It replaced a voice-only Viking analog entry phone. The latency is incredibly low, so is as effective as the Viking solution that rang my home and mobile phones simultaneously. 

Despite the IP54 rating, I installed with an additional Viking Enhanced Weather Protection housing. 

Also looking forward to the Cloud Archive solution as there is a lot of motion on my street, so the 20-event device history is too short.

title: Getting There
text: The app is improving but still lacking.  Specifically, there's no way to import your own ringtones.  The resident tones are too short and too plain.  Also, we should be able to set the brightness separately for each camera.

title: T Mobile phone users should think twice about the app
text:
The app works nicely on Wifi, but not on the T Mobile network.

When trying to access the streaming feed , via cellular data on the T Mobile network, there is no data. Without being able to see who is at the door or communicate with that person, there is little use for the app.

DoorBird should work with T Mobile to rectify the issue.

title: Works great with Door Bird product
text: App works seamlessly with the Door Bird product! Easy to set up - just scan the barcode on your Door Bird manual (passport) and you will be synced with your Door Bird. Easy to use and gives the product limitless range.

title: What an update!
text: It finally looks like an iPhone app. The mobile app was the only downside of this great product. I am really impressed by this last update. Keep up the good work!

title: Notifications always delayed
text: When someone rings the door bell there is a long delay before the notification is displayed on your phone. I'm always missing my deliveries because of this. My wifi connection is good, so that is not the problem. I think there is a bug in the app. I don't recommend it for this reason.

title: best IP intercom so far
text: It is getting better with every release. Forget about Ring, Skybell and other made in China gadgets. If you want a working solution DoorBird is the way to go.

title: Very good video intercom with minor drawbacks
text:
The DoorBird comes well packed and with all the necessary accessories. Installation, connection and commissioning was speedy and problem-free thanks to the accompanying documentation and worked at the first attempt.
I made the network connection (contrary to the manufacturer's recommendations) using a dLAN to Wi-Fi access point from the adjacent garage. The connection is rock solid and so long as you are satisfied with less than 25 frames per second, is also very stable (even with a smartphone on an LTE network; via EDGE it judders a lot, but the sound is still loud and clear).
The image quality is excellent, even in total darkness with the switchable infra-red lighting. It also almost achieves the 180¬∞ viewing angle. I mounted it at shoulder height. It des not make a video recording yet, but that will happen soon. A still image with the date and time is saved for events, and the history can be viewed in the app.
I haven‚Äôt tested the motion sensor yet.
The "Ringing‚Äù notification is only very slightly delayed (<1sec.). I also attached my existing door chime to the appropriate relay output of the DoorBird. Another relay output controls the door opener, which also works well with the app. I also made use of the optional connection to my garage door Liftmaster system (MyQ). There is still another connection free for an additional doorbell button, if needed.
The intercom also works well, with only a slight delay, and it‚Äôs easy to understand at both ends, despite the traffic on a main road. The frame rate of the camera is a little irregular, due to the limited bandwidth of a Wi-Fi network (as I said before, the manufacturer recommends a wired connection). However, this doesn‚Äôt limit its usability.

The app has a few minor weaknesses, but is well laid-out and runs reliably, and I like the Liftmaster connection. What I still haven't found is a way to delete stored messages. I couldn‚Äôt find anything about that in the instructions. Maybe it has a FIFO-type memory?

+ Installation and commissioning
+ Integration with existing doorbell system
+ Stable network connection
+ Picture and sound quality
+ Construction
+/- App is definitely still under development
- Price

title: Regret It, But Need It
text:
We were looking for a system that we could schedule trigger relays for our home since we run a business out of it from 8-5 and it seemed that DoorBird was the only one that could accomplish this task (so our AV guy said). Whenever the picture loads I do have good quality, but the picture takes FOREVER to switch to live view so I‚Äôm typically just letting anyone in when it‚Äôs locked because I fear for missing a package! If I wait until the video loads the courier is already back in their truck. This totally defeats the purpose of a gate and video system to filter who can come in and out. And we have the strongest internet on the block, our speeds are impeccable and have been verified by our AV guy on the spot so I don‚Äôt want to hear about it being a WiFi connection. It is an APP issue. We don‚Äôt have this issue with our R**g video system, EVER.

But the biggest headache is that if you have your iPhone set to VIBRATE the notification is COMPLETELY SILENT! I assumed that it would work like other video systems that adjust to the setting on your phone (my mistake I would NOT have purchased this if I knew notifications would be 100% silent even if my phone is set to VIBRATE). 

Because of this we miss SO many packages and SO many people have been locked out in the evenings because I have to be looking at my phone every second of every minute or else I‚Äôll miss the SILENT push notification. This is INSANE! I shouldn‚Äôt have to have my ringer volume on loud, annoying me and my children and my clients all day with loud pings from every single app and call I get just to use this ONE app. 

Extremely disappointing, and we spent a lot of money on what we thought was ‚Äúthe best system‚Äù I regret it and the past few months have been a SERIOUS HEADACHE for us because we cannot keep our phone volume on during the day so ya, we just miss 80% of anyone coming to the gate ever. We bought this to make our life easier and it has made it worse, because it‚Äôs just not functionally sound to have silent notifications. An app update needs to be made immediately to AT MINIMUM ensure that when an iPhone (or even Android) is switched to VIBRATE the DoorBird app push notifications ALSO VIBRATE.

title: Way better than Ring and Skybell
text:
After severe disappointments using Skybell and Ring I decided to try a third product. I bought a Doorbird, a German smartphone-doorbell. The problem with both Ring and Skybell was the low wifi-range and the really bad video and audio quality.
In fact I paid  almost $150.00 more than for the American products but the quality is way better. The distance from my door to my router is  240ft and only the oorbird is capable of working in this difficult environment. Doorbird‚Äôs  audio quality is excellent, even when I only have 3G available.
Great product.

also need a way to remove a relay if it‚Äôs. it in use.

title: No support, missing activation code
text: We were unable to activate this device for an important client due to missing activation code in box. Absolutely no support contact information. Do not trust this company with your business-critical installations.
